thread.title: Burned-out house in Silicon Valley sells for a whopping $938,000

title: Burned-out house in Silicon Valley sells for a whopping $938,000
text: Banks offer Hawaii volcano victims relief on mortgage payments, quick loans 22 Hours Ago Several banks are offering victims of the volcanic eruption in Hawaii grace periods on their mortgage payments and emergency loans, Bankrate reports. Here's why 7:34 AM ET Fri, 11 May 2018 Fewer millennials are moving into their own place because housing prices are outpacing wages, said Aaron Terrazas, senior economist at Zillow. 3:16 PM ET Thu, 10 May 2018 Hessam Nadji, Marcus & Millichap CEO, discusses how real estate investors are being impacted by tax reform. Chinese tycoon who bought the Waldorf Astoria Hotel gets 18 years in prison for $10 billion fraud 3:08 PM ET Thu, 10 May 2018 The Chinese tycoon who rose to international fame after buying New York's Waldorf Astoria Hotel was sentenced to 18 years in prison after being convicted of cheating investors out of more than $10 billion, the New York Times reports. Realtor.com Chief Economist Danielle Hale also weighs in. RBS reaches $4.9 billion deal to settle US mortgage bond probe 9:19 PM ET Wed, 9 May 2018 The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Wednesday it had reached an agreement in principle with the U.S. Department of Justice that includes a $4.9 billion civil penalty to resolve potential claims over mortgage-backed securities issued from 2005 to 2008. 5:16 PM ET Wed, 9 May 2018 California regulators voted Wednesday to approve a historic plan to mandate solar panels on new home construction. 9:09 PM ET Wed, 9 May 2018 California regulators voted Wednesday to approve a historic plan to mandate solar panels on new home construction. Deal is reached to sell the Plaza Hotel 2:51 PM ET Fri, 4 May 2018 Two investors have reached a deal to buy a majority share of the historic Plaza Hotel for $600 million, The New York Times reports.
